Instrument.name: 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft Thermal Emission Imaging System
Instrument.description: The 2001 Mars Odyssey Spacecraft (ODY) Thermal Emission Imaging System (THEMIS) flight instrument was designed to capture high-resolution images of the Martian surface. It uses both infrared and visible light to study temperature variations and surface composition. THEMIS provides data on surface features, mineral composition, and thermal properties, helping scientists understand Mars' geology and climate. It has been instrumental in identifying key landing sites and aiding in the selection of future exploration targets.
